name: Essential by Christophe
address: 103 W 77th St, New York, NY 10024, USA

reviews.text: Outstanding in every way. Flawless. Cant wait to be back. The beef stole the show.

I am a little reticent (selfishly) to write the glowing review this restaurant deserves, purely because I want to keep it a secret all for myself! I know it’s maintained a loyal customer base since opening, but I can’t express how nice it is to be able to still walk in and grab a spot at the bar most nights here. Most restaurants of this caliber that is not the case. This one just hits all the marks. My partner and I say it’s one of our favorite, if not our very favorite, restaurant in all of New York. The food, ambience, service all are of course 5 stars. Beyond those though there are many little intangible things about this place that really just push it into another realm. It’s truly special. It’s a true privilege to dine here and be treated by this staff. We will keep coming back.
Really enjoyed this restaurant and definitely coming back. Strongly reccomended. Well done Christophe!

Very much enjoyed this meal. Pro tip is that you can order à la carte if you sit at the bar, great if you want to keep it more casual than the formal dining room. The must gets are the lobster pasta and the burger — the Wagyu steak was great, but didn’t stand out versus other versions of it I’ve had. The desserts also stood out and were probably my favorite part of the meal.

Service was great at the bar. can’t speak to the dining room, but I’m sure excellent as well.

Value for money was excellent, we spent about $180 post tax & tip for two people. Also, we’re were given a couple small complementary bites.
My favorite meal I’ve had in NYC and Michael took great care of us. I see why Eric Ripert loves it, and I hope they get a second Michelin star soon!

Wonderful.

The mushroom opener, 11/10.

The bread was pretty meh though.

We went two times and were very happy and satisfied. Incredible cousin and service.
Will visit again when in NYC.

9.30.2025

i celebrated my birthday here with mom & i can say with full confidence that this is the best meal ive had this year.

comparing to other michelin french fine dining establishments, i would pick this as my top 1 for overall hospitality, food and price point. essential offers a truly unique seafood-focused menu with every course being as memorable or even better than the last. the flavor combinations are rich, perfectly well-balanced & all-around luxurious. dont underestimate the simple presentations because the taste will blow you away.

alfonso was our server—he was AMAZING! very attentive & made my night feel extra special with personal touches, check-ins throughout the meal as well as assisting me with my annoying vlog/photo sessions.

cant forget to mention that the dining room is extremely gorgeous with its warm yellow hues, flowers & intimate table settings—perfect for date night. im already looking forward to revisiting & telling all my friends about it. simply exceeded all my expectations—wont be surprised to see essential gain another star soon. thank you so much team!

Went to get a table, no reservation... Was told no tables are available. Okay. Fine. My fault for not making a reso. Offered to sit at the bar to dine. I agreed.

Once they figured out I was an influencer, a table magically opened up next to other tables that were empty.

Horrible way to treat a customer. I hope the owner reads this and trains their staff to be better.

EDIT IN RESPONSE TO OWNER: It is clear to me that your staff have a pattern of mistreating patrons at your establishment. If they did it to someone else, and did it to me... I'd say you have a big problem with how your staff conduct themselves. I wish your messaging to me would have been more regretful and reassure me that it wouldn't happen again. But it's your business, do what you want.

My review is an accurate depiction of my experience; future guests have been warned and can decide for themselves if they want to subject themselves to horrendous service from your staff.

Best meal of the year.
Every dish was perfectly executed, balanced flavors, no frills.
Smooth service.

As return customers, each visit continues to exceed our expectations. From the moment you walk in, the service is nothing short of impeccable: warm, personable, and genuine.

We have enjoyed almost every dish on the menu over multiple visits, and not a single bite has ever fallen short of phenomenal. This most recent experience was no exception with memorable standouts including the Madai  and Zebra Tomato starters, and Black Bass main. We always find a fantastic bottle of wine from their extensive wine list and their sommelier staff is highly knowledgeable.

It’s not just a meal here—it’s a culinary experience we look forward to every single time. We’re already looking forward to our next visit!

Essential by Christophe was a delightful experience! The food was incredibly fresh with rich, deep flavors—I enjoyed every single course. We had the three-course prix fixe menu, and the team was very accommodating with allergies and extremely attentive throughout. Overall, a fantastic meal and wonderful service. I can’t wait to come back!
so yummy food

One of the most amazing places we've been. Every dish was exquisite.  The flavors, the textures, the meat/fish choices, the bread including the gluten free selections. Christophe came out to chat with us after the meal and it was obvious he has a true passion for what he does, and it shows in how dishes are prepared. His staff was amazing, taking plenty of time to describe the ingredients and preparation that goes into each dish.  Not cheap, but worth every penny. You must go when in NYC.

We’ve tried Essential 3 times now and all 3 times it was superb. The staff is beyond excellent. The food has such elegance and all 3 times we were surprised at the new and interesting ways it was plated and served. Chef Christophe came out for a chat at our table the first time and it was such a pleasure to meet him. We can’t recommend this gem more.

Outstanding seafood prepared to perfection. Every dish was delicate, delicious, and clearly crafted with precision. The food here is truly a cut above. The staff is exceptional as well. From the sommelier to the bar team and food runners, everyone was attentive, friendly, and respectful, striking the perfect balance of professionalism and warmth.

If I had to mention one minor flaw, the air conditioning at the bar could be a little stronger. But honestly, that’s the only critique I can think of.

Highly recommend, this is a restaurant that delivers on every level.

Oh My Gord! (I'm referring here to my late Uncle Gordon, who loved a good restaurant).

Uncle Gord would have loved Essential.  This is Food as Art ... or Art as Food?  Either way, the presentation, the attention to detail, the  dedicated service.  Everything about this place screams: "We really care about your experience".

Speaking of which, Essential is more than a meal, it really is an "Experience".

I will return again and again.
Excellent food and service.
I have been to many restaurants in the area and this is one of the best. The food is clean, fresh and so tasty. I couldn’t say enough good things.

Truly exquisite. celebrated birthday on 26 june. Impressive parissiene standard cooking. This is a master chef - super fresh ingredients, sophisticated unfussy dishes. People who dine often in Paris will understand. We grieved the loss of Robuchon in NY, finally, now we have Essential. Best french restaurant in New York.

Experience- living the dream of tasting menu..delightful wonderful place
Special occasion..

This was my first time dining at Michelin one-star restaurant. I visited with my family, and it was truly a special experience for all of us. We ordered the three-course meal, and each dish was crafted with great care and attention to detail. The lobster dish, in particular, was absolutely delicious-perfectly cooked and full of flavor. The staff were very friendly, and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. The presentation was beautiful, and the service was impeccable. It was memorable evening, and I would love to come back for another special occasion.
5 star

Birthday celebration was memorable for so many reasons.  Our party of 7 sat in the large round table; a bit tight for serving the large plates but we had plenty of room. And it was perfect for conversation for our early dinner. We had the 3 & 4 tasting menus; a bit of a serving challenge that staff handled effortlessly.  With the amuse buche, freshly baked breads, extra birthday dessert and petits fours, it was an exquisite dining experience.  Each dish was a revelation for the senses (waygu, scallops, langoustine, lobster, crab, zebra tomato, bass, vacherin, tart, etc.).  While we could not have been happier or more satiated with our dinner choices, we do want to return for the full essential tasting menu.  A special shout-out and thanks to essential’s maître d’hôtel, who graciously accommodated our every request, especially the round banquette table, and answered many questions - often with wonderful humor; and to our superb server, Juan David, who gave helpful guidance and menu descriptions in the most charming and mesmerizing delivery — that I could have listened to all evening.  The service @essential was beyond exceptional and is what made our evening particularly memorable.  We will return!
Excellent service and the food is great very authentic.

We’ve dined at Essential (and loved it) but had never eaten at the bar before.  What a delight to get a hamburger with the exquisite detailed you’d expect from a Michelin star restaurant.  Unpretentious, laid back vibe and great service by Stephan behind the bar. Bravo.
A lovely dining experience. Interesting crafted cocktails and extensive wine list

From start to finish, the experience was flawless. Alphonse provided impeccable service, attentive and personable, while GM David Gagnon, truly orchestrated the perfect evening. His warmth, professionalism, and genuine passion for hospitality were evident in every interaction—anticipating our needs before we even voiced them. He set the tone for an exceptional dining experience. Later in the night, Christophe himself graciously introduced himself, a testament to the care and dedication behind every dish. The food was nothing short of extraordinary, and the atmosphere struck the perfect balance between elegance and comfort. A must-visit!

Can't wait to try the burger at the bar.

Great New Restaurant
Attentive service
Creativity
Chef owner
Fantastic birthday dinner here, would highly recommend a visit! Great options for 3/4/7 courses and the wine pairings are phenomenal.

I recently dined at Essential in New York with my girlfriend.
The food was exceptional and truly delicious.
Service was ok.
Overall, it was a good experience .
We will definitely come back
Extraordinary Cuisine and Great Service
Reserved for my birthday! Food tastes very fresh and good quality! But they forgot to bring us bread until the first course. Other than that everything is satisfying

Absolutely a most spectacular gastronomical journey. Started out with a Rosalita YUM. Tuna tartare clean and refreshing. Scallop - unreal in its delicate unctuousness, with a very generous topping of caviar indeed. Rouget was lovely. Squab and frog legs to DIE for - I could bathe in the frog legs garlic sauce. The burger is so yummy - and a gorgeous salad wedge on the side. And of course the Robouchon pommes purées!! The service was so warm and wonderful. And we got to meet Chef Christophe! What a lovely man. Everything here is cooked with love.

chef sent a few gift dishes.
米其林真的很爱各种口味的泡沫 吃着难受
以及不是很习惯法餐 当时吃乳鸽的时候心里就有点不妙 还特意查了下法国是不是就是做三分熟乳鸽
well 吃完半小时 大泄特泻 人均$300+  半小时内全出去了

After having eaten in many Michelin starred restaurants I will say that this is one of the best Meals that I’ve had in the last five years. Each course was perfectly prepared and beautifully presented.  The dining room,  which was overseen by Paul functioned seamlessly . I could not recommend the  experience highly enough…….
We dined here for graduation celebration. The dishes, service and vibe were absolutely incredible.

I've gone to many restaurants in the UWS over five years of living here, this is hands down the best dining experience so far. The food was top notch, the service was impeccable but not snooty, and the ambience was very cozy. Cannot say enough good things about this place, worth the price.
Amazing, second time here. I tried the non alcoholic wine pairing and it paired wonderfully with the food. The tasting menu took ~2.5 hours. Will definitely be back!

Many dishes carry a hint of citrus, which I absolutely love! The langoustine sauce is rich and unique, and the touch of citrus in the lobster makes it especially bright and flavorful. The wagyu beef is incredibly tender, paired with a side of mashed potatoes that are smooth and delicate. The vacherin has an intense aroma of cream, bergamot, and orange blossom. If there were a perfume with that scent, I’d buy it in a heartbeat! It tastes just as fresh as it smells. The soufflé, however, is a bit too sour for me. As for the cocktails, ‘Upstate’ feels perfectly wintry with its apple cider base, while ‘Always A Plum’ might be a good pick for martini lovers.

I dined here for the first time as a birthday celebration. The decor and ambience is very simple, clean, calm, and almost minimal. It's a small classy restaurant. The service was great and the food ? Really beautiful and everything tastes so good!! The presentation, the attention to detail...
We did the seven course tasting and although I was full by the end out of it, I do wish I could've had a huge bowl of the mushroom cappuccino lol
Visit for a first time last week and looking forward to come back again. Food 10/10 service A+. My compliment to chef:). You made something truly special — thank you for sharing your talent.
Deserves its second Michelin star!

The bill was reasonable the first time I went there with two friends—about $40 per person. However, the second time I went with just one friend, we ordered the same amount of food, but I was charged $390. It was ridiculous! This place is a huge scam. Don't go. To be honest, their food is not worth the money at all.

Perfection.  Elegant but not snooty service & decor & crowd.  The execution & delivery of the courses was impeccable, and the wine flight was creative & matched without flaw.  Loved everything; thanks Alfonso!  And ugh, the butter.  Sauces, bread course, every other way they did perfect French buttery goodness…we’re still smiling.  Thanks for a great evening.  We’ll return to sit at the bar & try the burger!

I chose this Michelin-starred restaurant to celebrate my brother’s birthday. Beyond the extraordinary cuisine, the attention to detail, the seamless harmony of the ambiance, and the impeccable service made the evening nothing short of exceptional. Every dish was a masterpiece, executed with brilliance. I find myself at a loss for words to fully capture the experience.

We had the pleasure of meeting Chef Christophe, whose kindness and welcoming presence made our dinner even more special.

I look forward to returning to Essential by Christophe and would highly recommend!

Loved it at the bar.  The simplest thing made special.  Who serves a half a burger and chips on a horizontal plate with a creamy dipping sauce for the fries?  And very special sense.  The dining room is several cuts above.

Christophe’s Essentials was the hottest haunt on the Upper East Side—effortlessly chic, unmistakably New York, and irresistibly French. Perfection in every bite.

I loved his philosophy: strip away the excess, focus on the essentials. The spotlight was on seafood, with each dish honoring the integrity of its ingredients. The creativity, paired with masterful finesse, elevated the dining experience to something extraordinary.

It wasn’t just a meal; it was an artful performance. A feast for the eyes, a symphony for the senses, and an indulgent journey for the palate. And the finale? A dark chocolate masterpiece that lingered like a beautiful memory.

Christophe is a star in New York’s culinary scene—an artist in his own right. I highly recommend this experience.

Top 3 restaurants in NYC right now, easily. From the food, to the ambience, to the service, everything is perfect every time. Recently, I had a very important guest in town and David went out of his way to make our evening even more special. Thank you to all the staff that make this restaurant so wonderful, with special thanks to Hector and Flannery. I will continue to spread the word and come back as soon as I am able.
Truly amazing. Interior space is well designed and food is some of the best in the city. Wine pairing is a must!
이 동네에서 이런 파인다이닝이 있어? 해서 가봤는데 다 맛있는데(특히 소스 존맛) 먹다보면 짠게 누적되서 와인이든 물이든 엄청 들이키게 됩니다....

Genuinely, the full tasting menu at Essential deserves all of the praise that I can give and more. Flavor combinations are interesting and unique while being exceedingly balanced but powerful, ingredient prep and cook is executed perfectly, and sequencing of the dishes is phenomenal. The staff is super unpretentious but yet extraordinarily knowledgeable about both the ingredients and the preparation of the dishes, and are friendly and happy to accommodate special requests. The entire experience here was the most impressive of any fine dining restaurant I've ever been to, and I can't recommend it enough.

The highlight dish for me was the diver scallop. Perfect cross hatch sear, beautiful cook, and great accompaniments on the plate.

The bartender is accommodating and skilled, and delivered perfectly balanced cocktails both on and off menu.

Saying this restaurant is worth the trip, the reservation, and the price is a severe understatement.

Wonderful New Year’s Eve dinner here. Excellent Michelin star service. Food was exquisite, with traditional fine dining that showcased the chefs’ talent but fused with immense creativity for every course. Expensive, but worth the value.

Hidden away in the upper west side of Manhattan, Essential by Christophe is one of the best prix fixe menus I have ever tried, beating out other one- and two-star restaurants.
The atmosphere is bright, warm, and quiet. The restaurant is clean, with the bathrooms being especially clean. The temperature was slightly too high for a jacket, which was a distracting factor.
When walking in, we were greeted warmly; the host did a good job of knowing our name, always adding to the meal. There is an intimate lounge and bar, serving a decent amount of drinks and snacks. Drinks and cocktails cost right around what you might expect; an example being the martini, placed at $24. The main dining room is directly next to the bar; the essential menu is the prix fixe, set at a reasonable price of $245.
The menu consists of 8-9 items; options are located at the second, sixth, and last course. Starting with a very well-balanced sweet potato and mushroom soup shot, fittingly called a Mushroom Cappuccino, sets the warm tone each dish has.
The scallop, sea bass, and wagyu were the most memorable after the first course.
The scallop sits in a thick sauce with a zucchini blossom; the zucchini blossom is what stood out to me. It had an extremely unique flavor and texture that I cannot fully describe.
Our server mentioned that the sea bass was one of Chef Christophe Bellanca’s most staple menu items; I understand why. This dish demonstrates Bellanca’s talent to break norms and expectations. Many components of sweet, punchy flavors, including pomegranate, were hidden beneath the sea bass. I have never had fish with such a unique flavor; it is truly a beautiful dish.
The wagyu was not special; it was perfect nonetheless. It was cooked well with a nice, thick, somewhat barbeque sauce. This satisfied my craving for delicious meat.
Service was the just right amount of attention, not distracting from the dishes. Other than the balance of attention and timing, I do not feel anything was extraordinary about the service.
Overall, Essential by Christophe is an amazing restaurant with some truly unique dishes at a fair price point.

David and the rest of the staff were great. First class all around. Food and service was outstanding. Wine they picked for our dinner was perfect and his description was spot on. Beautiful presentation. Atmosphere was comfortable and relaxing which is unusual for a 5 star restaurant. Truly enjoyable.

It was a tremendous and lovely dining experience. I especially enjoyed the attentive service, and everything I tasted was very good. We had 4 courses. The soufflé for dessert was extraordinary. Their Michelin star is more than deserved!

If you’re looking for a can’t miss dinner, this is it. We had the Essential 7 course meal and after each course we were amazed that they could keep getting better. There was not a single course that not a 10/10. The service and the presentation was top notch without being stuffy. Cannot recommend this place any higher. A must try.

I’ll be honest—I went bracing myself for the dreaded Michelin stiffness. You know, the kind where the service is either robotic or aggressively warm, the atmosphere so hushed you’re afraid to cough, and the whole thing feels more like a performance than a meal. But this place? It completely shattered those expectations.

Yes, it’s high-end, but it doesn’t smother you in formality. The design is modern and elegant, with warm beige tones that feel inviting rather than sterile. Noise levels are perfect—you can actually have a conversation without shouting, but it’s lively enough that you don’t feel like you’re dining in a church. And the best part? People aren’t sitting around in stiff suits looking miserable. You’ll see diners in polos, jeans, and nice shoes, which makes the experience feel effortlessly cool rather than pretentious.

Now, let’s talk about the food—because wow. Every course was a knockout. The plates are small, sure, but you get options (3, 4, or 7 courses), and the quality-to-price ratio is way better than other so-called fine dining spots that don’t even come close to this level of execution.

They kick things off with bread, and not just any bread—perfectly baked, crusty sourdough that’s so good you don’t even need butter (but trust me, use theirs, it’s worth it). Then comes the amuse-bouche: a mushroom cappuccino with a sweet potato custard that just melts in your mouth. If it had been twice the size, I still would have wanted more.

First course? I went with the tuna, and let me tell you, whoever is in charge of acidity here knows what they’re doing. Finding a raw dish with seasoning this spot-on is rare. Then came the langoustine—perfectly cooked, bathed in a sauce so good I genuinely considered licking the plate (I didn’t, but it was a close call). The lobster? Another win. The black pepper and coconut sauce actually delivers on the pepper part—a rarity in the world of “au poivre” anything.

Dessert sealed the deal. The chocolate tart is everything a chocolate dessert should be—rich but not cloying, with a deep bitterness that makes you want a second slice instead of regretting the first. And if you’re feeling adventurous, the L’Ardéchois (chestnut, rum, pear) is a knockout—it’s got a punch, but in the best way. They finish the night with a few petit fours because, of course, they do, and yes, they’re also great.

Service? Impeccable. The staff actually looked happy to be there (a small miracle in fine dining), and our server, Michael, was the perfect balance of warm, attentive, and never intrusive.

This place is a gem. A Michelin-starred spot that doesn’t feel like a museum exhibit. A high-end restaurant that actually makes you want to come back. And now that I’ve told you about it, I just hope I can still get a reservation.

There are not enough words to describe the incredible meal and service received here! All of the dishes were just as tasty as they seem on looks alone.

Michael, our server, deserves recognition on his passion for the menu by leaving me with no regrets from his impeccable dish recommendations. He came to our table at all the perfect times and was super friendly. Sofia was warm and inviting upon our arrival, sat our table, and made sure we were well taken care of. She was very attentive and reached out personally to ask about potential allergies even prior to our reservation. Michelle greeted us very kindly during our meal and Christophe introduced himself to us as well.

The staff is extremely warm and inviting, which only enhanced our experience. It's great to see how much the establishment values maintaining relationships with customers and what lengths they will go to in order to offer the most quality meal all around.

My experience at Essential by Christophe was nothing short of amazing.

I did not have a reservation. Though, after walking in, I was warmly welcomed by the host, and then shortly by the manager. They kindly escorted me to a seat at the bar as if they were already expecting me.

The bartender, Jose, greeted me with both their dining room tasting menu and their bar menu. I hadn’t realize I went in a few minutes before their last call on food, so I quickly perused the menus. I inquired with Jose on several menu items and he provided me with such concise descriptions and details of the dishes in such a swift manner. I was quite impressed. He did not at all make me feel rush, despite the time constraint. Hats off to him.

I don’t drink alcohol. However, their selection on non-alcoholic beverages, other than soft beverages, was abundant. Amongst their non-alcoholic wine, beer, & mock tails, I selected their Riesling. I’ve never experienced a non-alcoholic Riesling before, so it was nice to have that option for me, especially to pair with my food.

Prior to enjoying my meal, I was sent an amuse bouche: their “mushroom cappuccino”. What a pleasant surprise! Presented in a clear espresso cup, was what seemed like a sweet potato puree, with a truffle foam filled to the brim. It was a great combination of flavors. It was even better that it came as a surprise as I was not expecting a gift from the chef to start my meal.

As an appetizer, I enjoyed the scallops. There were two luscious scallops, with caviar on each, with a buttery, yet light, champagne foam surrounding each scallop. There was so much flavor and texture within this dish. Truly, there is no description that would do this dish justice.

For my entree, I ordered “Leo’s Favorite Burger”. Every component of this burger consisted of ingredients well thought out and crafted; the romaine with a light vinaigrette; the shoe string fries with the house-made spicy ketchup; and the caramelized onions on top of the prime beef patty between the sesame buns. Chef Christophe impressively executes an elegant burger.

I did not order dessert, however they sent me petit fours that were delectable and great palate cleansers. Another delightful surprise from the chef.

Overall, my experience at Essential by Christophe exceeded my expectations. My only regret is that I did not experience more dishes on the menu. I’ve already booked my reservation for a full tasting menu in the next few weeks and am looking forward to another wondrous experience.

This restaurant hasn't been open for long, but it has quickly gained popularity in New York.

They excel in capturing the essence of French cuisine, offering an exceptional dining environment and service. The head chef, who gained fame at Michelin-level French restaurants, has now ventured out on their own. They not only uphold the classic elements of French cuisine but also infuse it with their own creativity. In my opinion, it's more worthwhile to experience than several well-established French restaurants in New York.

Additionally, the service at the restaurant is attentive, catering to your individual preferences by adjusting dish combinations and flavors according to your liking. The staff is friendly yet respects diners' privacy, striking the perfect balance.

Furthermore, the ambiance and location of the restaurant are excellent. Whether you're planning to attend a concert, opera, or take a stroll in Central Park after dinner, the restaurant is conveniently located near these attractions. The dining experience they offer complements these activities well, making any leisurely outing more memorable.

Overall, it's a French restaurant worth experiencing for both tourists and locals alike.

One of the newest Michelin-starred restaurants in the city - was a hit for us and we would be delighted to return for special occasions. We had 4 courses, and found every dish to be sophisticated, balanced, and thoughtful. Each time the next course was on the way, it was easy to get excited to see what they had created. Service was friendly and unpretentious. Dining room was nicely designed with muted colors - and warmly lit - such that the colors and flavors on the plate were the stars. What a nice addition to the Upper West Side!

By far one of my favorite Michelin experiences. I’ve been coming to essential for special occasions for the past 2 years, and they never disappoint! Lobster rigatoni and scallops> Thank you David, Tyler and others for your hospitality!

Had a beautiful valentine’s dinner at Essential. David and the rest of the staff were wonderful. The attention to detail, both in the food and the experience, was outstanding. Every course was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. Cannot recommend it enough!

I can’t understand how this place isn’t booked out the second reservations are released.
The food was faultless and the service was friendly and unpretentious. Amazing wine matches. I will definitely be back - my new fave in NYC.
Christophe was kind enough to come and say hello, the whole service team were amazing. Thank you for making our celebrations so memorable.

Fabulous new discovery for me on the UWS (thank you Bill Ackman for recommending). Such a warm, inviting, and elegant spot (and altho music was being played, the sound level was optimal for conversation). Since I was solo dining, I opted for bar seating and it was perfect. Food is fantastic. The chicken dish is amazing. I ordered a la carte but other diners around me ordered the set menu which looked great also. I will definitely be back.

I want to leave some of the bad vibes in 2024 and look forward to this excellent restaurant having a great 2025.

The food was good. Chef Christophe clearly put a lot of thought into creating and preparing the Essential Menu, which blends classic French cuisine with flavors from around the world. In my opinion, the food deserves a Michelin one-star+ rating and isn’t too far from a solid two-star level. It wasn’t mind-blowing, but within its well-structured approach, I found touches like Mexican BBQ and Thai Tom Yum flavors, which was fun.

What really let me down was the wine pairing. I ordered the most expensive option at $295 per person for the premium pairing, but it was far below my expectations. I was hoping for something creative from the sommelier, showcasing rare and unique wines, but the pairing felt like a series of “standard answers.” Out of the six wines, I’d already had four of them before.

First, the promised premium cru Champagne was swapped out for a $20 bottle of generic Bourgogne Aligoté. I don’t understand how a wine like that makes it into a “premium pairing”—it was bland and simple. Then came wines like Hans Wirsching, Lynch-Bages Blanc, and Dönnhoff, all of which are extremely common and easy to find. The combined market price of all the wines served wouldn’t even reach $295. The only highlight was a 2015 Meursault, but even that wasn’t 1er cru. The biggest disappointment was the red wine paired with the meat: a weak, diluted Rhône Syrah that just didn’t work.

What’s more, I noticed the restaurant served almost everyone who ordered the wine pairing the same lineup, except for the Meursault. I really don’t understand how a village-level Meursault, priced under $100 per bottle, justifies a $130 premium in the pairing. Overall, the wine list was boring and didn’t reflect any effort or taste from the sommelier. I’d honestly think other restaurants in New York at the same level nailed their wine pairings way better. Otherwise, I could pair my own wine by myself.

One last thing I found pretty annoying: the waitstaff listening on my conversations with my companion.

We had our Valentine’s Day dinner here. The food is amazing! Especially the truffle, foi gras and urchin. The mashed potato is very fine and creamy.
The gave us an extra mushroom cappuccino to start and a butter cake to take home. We loved both of them.
You should also try the wine pairing for sure. They are good at it!

Quite possibly the best dining experience my wife and I have ever had. Service was flawless, the food was as absolutely amazing. It’s everything a Michelin experience should be with none of the pretense comes along with it.

From the moment we walked in to the moment we walked out I had an amazing time here tonight. Everybody makes you feel so welcomed and our waiter Michael made our experience super enjoyable. Be sure to request him! My partner and I had the 4 course pre fixe. We started off with the Rosalita cocktail, then we moved on to the yellow fin tuna and the sea urchin, both dishes were amazing. Then we had the scallops and artichoke, words can’t describe how phenomenal these dishes were !  We then had the black bass and the wagyu beef cap, our waiter recommended medium rare which was a great touch. We also paired those dishes with the Clear Sky cocktail which Michael recommended and let me tell you, he knows his flavors! We finally ended our night with the mango mango, fine feuilles and a cup of chamomile tea. I will 100% be back here, the chef came out and greeted us which made our night very special. Thank You for having us ❤️

Blown away! This is a true Upper West side gem. Service and atmosphere are impeccable, the 4 course menu is eclectic, elevated and refined. We feel the inspiration from Robuchon in multiple little things like the puree or the olive bread. The courses are generous without being overpowering and some of the assemblages are corky yet creating the perfect alchemy in tastes. Essential competes very well against some of the 2 or even 3 stars restaurants in NY and the seasonal menu will get us to come back  at least every season.

For my and my husband’s first ever Michelin star dining experience, Essential met our expectations and then went well beyond them.

Our server, Lucas, was kind and helpful with explaining menu items and made wonderful suggestions based on what we told him about our taste.

We did the 4 course plus wine pairing for each of us.

My husband ordered the cuttlefish, frog legs, wagyu, and then the vacherin for dessert. He was very impressed with the dishes and the wine pairings alike. He’s the son of a trained chef and loves trying new and interesting things and this did not disappoint in any way.

I ordered the sea urchin, scallops, poularde, and the l’ardechois for dessert. I was looking forward to trying some new things and that I did. Everything was cooked to perfection and so delicious, and the wine pairings for our dishes were just amazing.

As a born and raised New Yorker, bringing my husband to spend his first Christmas here and it being almost our one year wedding anniversary is a special occasion to us; We mentioned this to Lucas and they brought us a small extra dessert and wrote “Happy Anniversary” on our individual dessert plates as well, just the perfect special touch.

I would 1000% recommend Essential to anyone looking for a true fine dining experience, whether it’s your first, like ours, or you’re used to it.

had a lovely birthday dinner here! we did the un, deux, trois, plus dessert menu, rather than the tasting menu, and it was a PERFECT amount of food. the menu itself is very seafood forward, and the technique on every plate is elevated while still being new/different than any other french restaurant. The waitstaff is top tier… definitely on par with michelin restaurant.

The first course we did the alaskan king crab tomato and the foie- both were excellent. I think the foie portion was the most generous I’ve ever gotten in the city. I was worried we might be too full after just that, but we made space for everything because it was so good.

The second course we did the scallop and the blue prawn, and honestly it’s hard to say which one was better. The scallop came with the most delicious sauce- and so was lightly cooked it was almost like eating a sashimi. It was tender and perfection. The blue prawn was more cooked and was topped again with a generous portion of kaluga caviar.

For our third course/entree, we did the ibérico pork and the lobster. Wow- the ibérico pork was stellar and truly a one of a kind dish… I have never had medium rare pork like that, but it was mind blowing. The lobster was also excellent, but not quite as good as the ibérico pork.

Also the pro for choosing your menu, you get more choices for your dessert course. We did cheeses and the souffle. The souffle was very good, but a little on the egg-y side for me. The cardamom ice cream that it comes with though… AMAZING. The cheeses were also very good, but after all the food- it was hard to finish. We took home the little madeleines and canneles and they were seriously stellar. The pastry chef knows what’s up.

This was my first experience with French cuisine and it was amazing! It seems French cuisine is a way of cooking and not any particular food! I was surprised! I came for my 40th birthday, too bad I waited that long to find out what it is, not snails and frog legs lol, come try it out! We got the largest course you could get each and ordered different things and essentially tried everything on the menu!
